Hey John, I really like the topology/offpsring (species) 
visualization.  That's really interesting.  It would be really cool 
also if you could also view the current champ topology and what it 
does.  (as of you haven't already done enough!)

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "John Arrowwood" <jarrowwx@h...> wrote:
> >From: Colin Green <cgreen@d...>
> >
> >John Arrowwood wrote:
> >
> > >For the rest, I spent the weekend making all kinds of nice 
graphs and
> > >visualizations, and cool stuff like that.  Check out the new, 
colorful
> > >status page:
> > >
> > >
> > >http://www.hanlonsrazor.com:81/neat/iex/reports/
> > >
> > >
> >Very impressive graphs John. How are you generating them?
> 
> Perl module GD::Graph.  Works pretty well, and is pretty easy to 
use.
> 
> >There's a definite rise in the current fitness graph, seems to be
> >levelling off at the momement though.
> 
> Yep.  That happened last time, too.  Then as the current champions 
become 
> stagnant and die off, all that is left are the less fit members, 
and so the 
> max fitness graph could angle back downward for a time.
